intro: Diclytra pauciflora, commonly known as the few-flowered diclytra, is a species of flowering plant in the family Brassicaceae. It is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers that are typically arranged in clusters. The plant has linear, often hairy leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. It is native to regions of southern Africa, where it grows in grassy areas and open woodlands. Diclytra pauciflora is typically found in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptation to dry climates.
